<Link id="l00005" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0 WITH LLVM-exception</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00006" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00007" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// DependenceAnalysis is an LLVM pass that analyses dependences between memory</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// accesses. Currently, it is an implementation of the approach described in</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//            Practical Dependence Testing</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//            Goff, Kennedy, Tseng</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//            PLDI 1991</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// There&#39;s a single entry point that analyzes the dependence between a pair</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// of memory references in a function, returning either NULL, for no dependence,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// or a more-or-less detailed description of the dependence between them.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This pass exists to support the DependenceGraph pass. There are two separate</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// passes because there&#39;s a useful separation of concerns. A dependence exists</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// if two conditions are met:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    1) Two instructions reference the same memory location, and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    2) There is a flow of control leading from one instruction to the other.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// DependenceAnalysis attacks the first condition; DependenceGraph will attack</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the second (it&#39;s not yet ready).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Please note that this is work in progress and the interface is subject to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// change.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Plausible changes:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    Return a set of more precise dependences instead of just one dependence</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    summarizing all.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Dependence - This class represents a dependence between two memory</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// memory references in a function. It contains minimal information and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// is used in the very common situation where the compiler is unable to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// determine anything beyond the existence of a dependence; that is, it</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// represents a confused dependence (see also FullDependence). In most</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// cases (for output, flow, and anti dependences), the dependence implies</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// an ordering, where the source must precede the destination; in contrast,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// input dependences are unordered.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// When a dependence graph is built, each Dependence will be a member of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the set of predecessor edges for its destination instruction and a set</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// if successor edges for its source instruction. These sets are represented</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// as singly-linked lists, with the &quot;next&quot; fields stored in the dependence</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// itelf.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dependence"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dependence/#a4c3f23d19aa97b3c23515aa8011ebdb6">Dependence</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">protected</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// FullDependence - This class represents a dependence between two memory</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// references in a function. It contains detailed information about the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// dependence (direction vectors, etc.) and is used when the compiler is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="221"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// able to accurately analyze the interaction of the references; that is,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="222"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// it is not a confused dependence (see Dependence). In most cases</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="223"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// (for output, flow, and anti dependences), the dependence implies an</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="224"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// ordering, where the source must precede the destination; in contrast,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="225"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// input dependences are unordered.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00226" /><CodeLine lineNumber="226" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/fulldependence"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/fulldependence/#a8988356819c51e6dfd3296fde1480ace">FullDependence</a> final : </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dependence/#a4c3f23d19aa97b3c23515aa8011ebdb6">Dependence</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00291" /><CodeLine lineNumber="291"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// DependenceInfo - This class is the main dependence-analysis driver.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00292" /><CodeLine lineNumber="292"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00293" /><CodeLine lineNumber="293" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dependenceinfo"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dependenceinfo/#a6e0908efeae361bba872b8d4abd6eccd">DependenceInfo</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00295" /><CodeLine lineNumber="295" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dependenceinfo/#a6e0908efeae361bba872b8d4abd6eccd"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dependenceinfo/#a6e0908efeae361bba872b8d4abd6eccd">DependenceInfo</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/aaresults">AAResults</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/aa">AA</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a> &#42;SE,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00296" /><CodeLine lineNumber="296"><Highlight kind="normal">                   <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopinfo">LoopInfo</a> &#42;LI)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00297" /><CodeLine lineNumber="297"><Highlight kind="normal">        : <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/aa">AA</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/aa">AA</a>), SE(SE), LI(LI), <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>) &#123;&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00298" /><CodeLine lineNumber="298"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00299" /><CodeLine lineNumber="299"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Handle transitive invalidation when the cached analysis results go away.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00300" /><CodeLine lineNumber="300"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dependenceinfo/#a10d6c1036e234fab6e63803cf9fb62de">invalidate</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/preservedanalyses">PreservedAnalyses</a> &amp;PA,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00303" /><CodeLine lineNumber="303"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// depends - Tests for a dependence between the Src and Dst instructions.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00304" /><CodeLine lineNumber="304"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Returns NULL if no dependence; otherwise, returns a Dependence (or a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00305" /><CodeLine lineNumber="305"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// FullDependence) with as much information as can be gleaned.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00306" /><CodeLine lineNumber="306"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// The flag PossiblyLoopIndependent should be set by the caller</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00307" /><CodeLine lineNumber="307"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// if it appears that control flow can reach from Src to Dst</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00308" /><CodeLine lineNumber="308"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// without traversing a loop back edge.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00309" /><CodeLine lineNumber="309"><Highlight kind="normal">    std::unique&#95;ptr&lt;Dependence&gt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dependenceinfo/#a49197b24cced248bed2d2c89c641a6dd">depends</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;Src,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00310" /><CodeLine lineNumber="310"><Highlight kind="normal">                                        <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;Dst,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00311" /><CodeLine lineNumber="311"><Highlight kind="normal">                                        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> PossiblyLoopIndependent);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00312" /><CodeLine lineNumber="312"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00313" /><CodeLine lineNumber="313"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// getSplitIteration - Give a dependence that&#39;s splittable at some</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00314" /><CodeLine lineNumber="314"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// particular level, return the iteration that should be used to split</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00315" /><CodeLine lineNumber="315"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// the loop.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00316" /><CodeLine lineNumber="316"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00317" /><CodeLine lineNumber="317"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Generally, the dependence analyzer will be used to build</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="318"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// a dependence graph for a function (basically a map from instructions</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00319" /><CodeLine lineNumber="319"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// to dependences). Looking for cycles in the graph shows us loops</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00320" /><CodeLine lineNumber="320"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// that cannot be trivially vectorized/parallelized.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00321" /><CodeLine lineNumber="321"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00322" /><CodeLine lineNumber="322"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// We can try to improve the situation by examining all the dependences</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00323" /><CodeLine lineNumber="323"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// that make up the cycle, looking for ones we can break.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00324" /><CodeLine lineNumber="324"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Sometimes, peeling the first or last iteration of a loop will break</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00325" /><CodeLine lineNumber="325"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// dependences, and there are flags for those possibilities.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00326" /><CodeLine lineNumber="326"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Sometimes, splitting a loop at some other iteration will do the trick,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="327"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// and we&#39;ve got a flag for that case. Rather than waste the space to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="328"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// record the exact iteration (since we rarely know), we provide</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00329" /><CodeLine lineNumber="329"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// a method that calculates the iteration. It&#39;s a drag that it must work</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00330" /><CodeLine lineNumber="330"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// from scratch, but wonderful in that it&#39;s possible.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00331" /><CodeLine lineNumber="331"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="332"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Here&#39;s an example:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00333" /><CodeLine lineNumber="333"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="334"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///    for (i = 0; i &lt; 10; i++)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="335"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///        A&#91;i&#93; = ...</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="336"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///        ... = A&#91;11 - i&#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="337"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="338"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// There&#39;s a loop-carried flow dependence from the store to the load,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="339"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// found by the weak-crossing SIV test. The dependence will have a flag,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="340"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// indicating that the dependence can be broken by splitting the loop.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="341"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Calling getSplitIteration will return 5</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00342" /><CodeLine lineNumber="342"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Splitting the loop breaks the dependence, like so:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="343"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00344" /><CodeLine lineNumber="344"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///    for (i = 0; i &lt;= 5; i++)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="345"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///        A&#91;i&#93; = ...</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00346" /><CodeLine lineNumber="346"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///        ... = A&#91;11 - i&#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00347" /><CodeLine lineNumber="347"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///    for (i = 6; i &lt; 10; i++)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00348" /><CodeLine lineNumber="348"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///        A&#91;i&#93; = ...</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00349" /><CodeLine lineNumber="349"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///        ... = A&#91;11 - i&#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00350" /><CodeLine lineNumber="350"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00351" /><CodeLine lineNumber="351"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// breaks the dependence and allows us to vectorize/parallelize</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00352" /><CodeLine lineNumber="352"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// both loops.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00353" /><CodeLine lineNumber="353"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dependenceinfo/#a110f1f473cbb5a42bf9c82973ac9101c">getSplitIteration</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dependence">Dependence</a> &amp;Dep, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Level);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00354" /><CodeLine lineNumber="354"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00355" /><CodeLine lineNumber="355" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dependenceinfo/#a4009b44221972360b0b0fb7dbf1cc7f0"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dependenceinfo/#a4009b44221972360b0b0fb7dbf1cc7f0">getFunction</a>()</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>; &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00356" /><CodeLine lineNumber="356"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00357" /><CodeLine lineNumber="357"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">private</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00390" /><CodeLine lineNumber="390"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Constraint - This private class represents a constraint, as defined</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00391" /><CodeLine lineNumber="391"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// in the paper</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00392" /><CodeLine lineNumber="392"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00393" /><CodeLine lineNumber="393"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///           Practical Dependence Testing</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00394" /><CodeLine lineNumber="394"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///           Goff, Kennedy, Tseng</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00395" /><CodeLine lineNumber="395"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///           PLDI 1991</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00396" /><CodeLine lineNumber="396"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00397" /><CodeLine lineNumber="397"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// There are 5 kinds of constraint, in a hierarchy.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00398" /><CodeLine lineNumber="398"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///   1) Any - indicates no constraint, any dependence is possible.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00399" /><CodeLine lineNumber="399"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///   2) Line - A line ax + by = c, where a, b, and c are parameters,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00400" /><CodeLine lineNumber="400"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///             representing the dependence equation.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00401" /><CodeLine lineNumber="401"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///   3) Distance - The value d of the dependence distance;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00402" /><CodeLine lineNumber="402"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///   4) Point - A point &lt;x, y&gt; representing the dependence from</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00403" /><CodeLine lineNumber="403"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///              iteration x to iteration y.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00404" /><CodeLine lineNumber="404"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///   5) Empty - No dependence is possible.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00405" /><CodeLine lineNumber="405"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">Constraint &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00406" /><CodeLine lineNumber="406"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">private</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00407" /><CodeLine lineNumber="407"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">enum</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ConstraintKind &#123; Empty, Point, Distance, Line, Any &#125; Kind;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00408" /><CodeLine lineNumber="408"><Highlight kind="normal">      ScalarEvolution &#42;SE;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00409" /><CodeLine lineNumber="409"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SCEV &#42;A;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00410" /><CodeLine lineNumber="410"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SCEV &#42;B;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00411" /><CodeLine lineNumber="411"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SCEV &#42;C;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00412" /><CodeLine lineNumber="412"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Loop &#42;AssociatedLoop;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00413" /><CodeLine lineNumber="413"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00457" /><CodeLine lineNumber="457"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Loop &#42;getAssociatedLoop() </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00479" /><CodeLine lineNumber="479"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00480" /><CodeLine lineNumber="480"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// establishNestingLevels - Examines the loop nesting of the Src and Dst</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00481" /><CodeLine lineNumber="481"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// instructions and establishes their shared loops. Sets the variables</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00482" /><CodeLine lineNumber="482"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// CommonLevels, SrcLevels, and MaxLevels.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00483" /><CodeLine lineNumber="483"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// The source and destination instructions needn&#39;t be contained in the same</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00484" /><CodeLine lineNumber="484"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// loop. The routine establishNestingLevels finds the level of most deeply</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00485" /><CodeLine lineNumber="485"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// nested loop that contains them both, CommonLevels. An instruction that&#39;s</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00486" /><CodeLine lineNumber="486"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// not contained in a loop is at level = 0 MaxLevels is equal to the level</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00487" /><CodeLine lineNumber="487"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// of the source plus the level of the destination, minus CommonLevels.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00488" /><CodeLine lineNumber="488"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// This lets us allocate vectors MaxLevels in length, with room for every</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00489" /><CodeLine lineNumber="489"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// distinct loop referenced in both the source and destination subscripts.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00490" /><CodeLine lineNumber="490"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// The variable SrcLevels is the nesting depth of the source instruction.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00491" /><CodeLine lineNumber="491"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// It&#39;s used to help calculate distinct loops referenced by the destination.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00492" /><CodeLine lineNumber="492"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Here&#39;s the map from loops to levels:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00493" /><CodeLine lineNumber="493"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///            0 - unused</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00494" /><CodeLine lineNumber="494"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///            1 - outermost common loop</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00495" /><CodeLine lineNumber="495"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///          ... - other common loops</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00496" /><CodeLine lineNumber="496"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// CommonLevels - innermost common loop</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00497" /><CodeLine lineNumber="497"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///          ... - loops containing Src but not Dst</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00498" /><CodeLine lineNumber="498"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///    SrcLevels - innermost loop containing Src but not Dst</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00499" /><CodeLine lineNumber="499"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///          ... - loops containing Dst but not Src</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00500" /><CodeLine lineNumber="500"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///    MaxLevels - innermost loop containing Dst but not Src</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00501" /><CodeLine lineNumber="501"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Consider the follow code fragment:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00502" /><CodeLine lineNumber="502"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///    for (a = ...) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00503" /><CodeLine lineNumber="503"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///      for (b = ...) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00504" /><CodeLine lineNumber="504"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///        for (c = ...) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00505" /><CodeLine lineNumber="505"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///          for (d = ...) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00506" /><CodeLine lineNumber="506"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///            A&#91;&#93; = ...;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00507" /><CodeLine lineNumber="507"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///          &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00508" /><CodeLine lineNumber="508"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///        &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00509" /><CodeLine lineNumber="509"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///        for (e = ...) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00510" /><CodeLine lineNumber="510"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///          for (f = ...) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00511" /><CodeLine lineNumber="511"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///            for (g = ...) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00512" /><CodeLine lineNumber="512"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///              ... = A&#91;&#93;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00513" /><CodeLine lineNumber="513"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///            &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00514" /><CodeLine lineNumber="514"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///          &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00515" /><CodeLine lineNumber="515"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///        &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00516" /><CodeLine lineNumber="516"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///      &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00517" /><CodeLine lineNumber="517"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00518" /><CodeLine lineNumber="518"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// If we&#39;re looking at the possibility of a dependence between the store</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00519" /><CodeLine lineNumber="519"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// to A (the Src) and the load from A (the Dst), we&#39;ll note that they</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00520" /><CodeLine lineNumber="520"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// have 2 loops in common, so CommonLevels will equal 2 and the direction</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00521" /><CodeLine lineNumber="521"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// vector for Result will have 2 entries. SrcLevels = 4 and MaxLevels = 7</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00522" /><CodeLine lineNumber="522"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// A map from loop names to level indices would look like</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00523" /><CodeLine lineNumber="523"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///     a - 1</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00524" /><CodeLine lineNumber="524"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///     b - 2 = CommonLevels</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00525" /><CodeLine lineNumber="525"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///     c - 3</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00526" /><CodeLine lineNumber="526"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///     d - 4 = SrcLevels</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00527" /><CodeLine lineNumber="527"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///     e - 5</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00528" /><CodeLine lineNumber="528"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///     f - 6</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00529" /><CodeLine lineNumber="529"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///     g - 7 = MaxLevels</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00530" /><CodeLine lineNumber="530"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> establishNestingLevels(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Instruction &#42;Src,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00531" /><CodeLine lineNumber="531"><Highlight kind="normal">                                </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Instruction &#42;Dst);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00532" /><CodeLine lineNumber="532"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00533" /><CodeLine lineNumber="533"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> CommonLevels, SrcLevels, MaxLevels;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00534" /><CodeLine lineNumber="534"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00535" /><CodeLine lineNumber="535"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// mapSrcLoop - Given one of the loops containing the source, return</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00536" /><CodeLine lineNumber="536"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// its level index in our numbering scheme.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00537" /><CodeLine lineNumber="537"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> mapSrcLoop(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Loop &#42;SrcLoop) </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00538" /><CodeLine lineNumber="538"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00539" /><CodeLine lineNumber="539"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// mapDstLoop - Given one of the loops containing the destination,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00540" /><CodeLine lineNumber="540"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// return its level index in our numbering scheme.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00541" /><CodeLine lineNumber="541"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> mapDstLoop(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Loop &#42;DstLoop) </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00542" /><CodeLine lineNumber="542"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00543" /><CodeLine lineNumber="543"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// isLoopInvariant - Returns true if Expression is loop invariant</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00544" /><CodeLine lineNumber="544"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// in LoopNest.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00545" /><CodeLine lineNumber="545"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> isLoopInvariant(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SCEV &#42;Expression, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Loop &#42;LoopNest) </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00546" /><CodeLine lineNumber="546"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00547" /><CodeLine lineNumber="547"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Makes sure all subscript pairs share the same integer type by</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00549" /><CodeLine lineNumber="549"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Sign-extending a subscript is safe because getelementptr assumes the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00550" /><CodeLine lineNumber="550"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// array subscripts are signed.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00552" /><CodeLine lineNumber="552"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00553" /><CodeLine lineNumber="553"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// removeMatchingExtensions - Examines a subscript pair.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00554" /><CodeLine lineNumber="554"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// If the source and destination are identically sign (or zero)</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00556" /><CodeLine lineNumber="556"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// simplify the actual analysis.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00557" /><CodeLine lineNumber="557"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> removeMatchingExtensions(Subscript &#42;Pair);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00558" /><CodeLine lineNumber="558"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00559" /><CodeLine lineNumber="559"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// collectCommonLoops - Finds the set of loops from the LoopNest that</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00562" /><CodeLine lineNumber="562"><Highlight kind="normal">                            </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Loop &#42;LoopNest,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00563" /><CodeLine lineNumber="563"><Highlight kind="normal">                            SmallBitVector &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/hexagon/hexagonhardwareloops-cpp/#ada7c1594a393ede3ce32602d64d7ddb2">Loops</a>) </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00564" /><CodeLine lineNumber="564"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00565" /><CodeLine lineNumber="565"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// checkSrcSubscript - Examines the SCEV Src, returning true iff it&#39;s</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00577" /><CodeLine lineNumber="577"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// isKnownPredicate - Compare X and Y using the predicate Pred.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00578" /><CodeLine lineNumber="578"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Basically a wrapper for SCEV::isKnownPredicate,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00595" /><CodeLine lineNumber="595"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00596" /><CodeLine lineNumber="596"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// collectUpperBound - All subscripts are the same type (on my machine,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00597" /><CodeLine lineNumber="597"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// an i64). The loop bound may be a smaller type. collectUpperBound</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00598" /><CodeLine lineNumber="598"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// find the bound, if available, and zero extends it to the Type T.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00599" /><CodeLine lineNumber="599"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// (I zero extend since the bound should always be &gt;= 0.)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00600" /><CodeLine lineNumber="600"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// If no upper bound is available, return NULL.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00601" /><CodeLine lineNumber="601"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SCEV &#42;collectUpperBound(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Loop &#42;l, <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/demangle/itaniumdemangle-h/#a88ee8e4eea43084bd8964682683da88caa1fa27779242b4902f7ae3bdd5c6d508">Type</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/mips/mips16isellowering-cpp/#a0acb682b8260ab1c60b918599864e2e5">T</a>) </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00602" /><CodeLine lineNumber="602"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00603" /><CodeLine lineNumber="603"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// collectConstantUpperBound - Calls collectUpperBound(), then</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00604" /><CodeLine lineNumber="604"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// attempts to cast it to SCEVConstant. If the cast fails,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00605" /><CodeLine lineNumber="605"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// returns NULL.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00606" /><CodeLine lineNumber="606"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SCEVConstant &#42;collectConstantUpperBound(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Loop &#42;l, <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/demangle/itaniumdemangle-h/#a88ee8e4eea43084bd8964682683da88caa1fa27779242b4902f7ae3bdd5c6d508">Type</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/mips/mips16isellowering-cpp/#a0acb682b8260ab1c60b918599864e2e5">T</a>) </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00608" /><CodeLine lineNumber="608"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// classifyPair - Examines the subscript pair (the Src and Dst SCEVs)</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00617" /><CodeLine lineNumber="617"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// testZIV - Tests the ZIV subscript pair (Src and Dst) for dependence.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00618" /><CodeLine lineNumber="618"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Returns true if any possible dependence is disproved.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00619" /><CodeLine lineNumber="619"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// If there might be a dependence, returns false.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00620" /><CodeLine lineNumber="620"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// If the dependence isn&#39;t proven to exist,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00621" /><CodeLine lineNumber="621"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// marks the Result as inconsistent.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00627" /><CodeLine lineNumber="627"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Things of the form &#91;c1 + a1&#42;i&#93; and &#91;c2 + a2&#42;j&#93;, where</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00769" /><CodeLine lineNumber="769"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// symbolicRDIVtest - Tests the RDIV subscript pair for dependence.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00770" /><CodeLine lineNumber="770"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Things of the form &#91;c1 + a&#42;i&#93; and &#91;c2 + b&#42;j&#93;,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00771" /><CodeLine lineNumber="771"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// where i and j are induction variable, c1 and c2 are loop invariant,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00773" /><CodeLine lineNumber="773"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Returns true if any possible dependence is disproved.</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00912" /><CodeLine lineNumber="912"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// If the simplification isn&#39;t exact (that is, if it is conservative</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00913" /><CodeLine lineNumber="913"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// in terms of dependence), set consistent to false.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00914" /><CodeLine lineNumber="914"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> propagateLine(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SCEV &#42;&amp;Src,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00919" /><CodeLine lineNumber="919"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// findCoefficient - Given a linear SCEV,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00920" /><CodeLine lineNumber="920"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// return the coefficient corresponding to specified loop.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00921" /><CodeLine lineNumber="921"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// If there isn&#39;t one, return the SCEV constant 0</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00922" /><CodeLine lineNumber="922"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// For example, given a&#42;i + b&#42;j + c&#42;k, returning the coefficient</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00923" /><CodeLine lineNumber="923"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// corresponding to the j loop would yield b.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
